text:
Robin Ophelia Quivers (born August 8, 1952) is an American radio personality. She is best known for being the long-running news anchor and co-host of "The Howard Stern Show" since 1981. She served in the United States Air Force between 1975 and 1990, rising to the rank of captain.
Quivers was born in Baltimore, Maryland. She is an endometrial cancer survivor.
